trans-unit.source: Scene renderers let you customize the collect and draw phases of the rendering. For more information about these stages, see Render features.
trans-unit.target: Scene renderers let you customize the collect and draw phases of the rendering. For more information about these stages, see Render features.

trans-unit.source: You select scene renderers in the entry points node properties.
trans-unit.target: You select scene renderers in the entry points node properties.

trans-unit.source: For more information about selecting renderers, see the Graphics compositor page.
trans-unit.target: For more information about selecting renderers, see the Graphics compositor page.

trans-unit.source: !Note Currently, all renderers must have a camera, or be a child of a renderer that has a camera. This applies even to renderers that don't necessarily use cameras, such as the single stage renderer (eg to render a UI).
trans-unit.target: !Note Currently, all renderers must have a camera, or be a child of a renderer that has a camera. This applies even to renderers that don't necessarily use cameras, such as the single stage renderer (eg to render a UI).

trans-unit.source: Clears a frame, with a solid color.
trans-unit.target: Clears a frame, with a solid color.

trans-unit.source: What to clear in the render frame (Color only, Depth only, or Color and depth)
trans-unit.target: What to clear in the render frame (Color only, Depth only, or Color and depth)

trans-unit.source: The color used to clear the color texture of the render frame. Only valid when Clear Flags is set to Color or Color and depth
trans-unit.target: The color used to clear the color texture of the render frame. Only valid when Clear Flags is set to Color or Color and depth

trans-unit.source: The depth value used to clear the depth texture of the render frame
trans-unit.target: The depth value used to clear the depth texture of the render frame

trans-unit.source: The stencil value used to clear the stencil texture of the render frame
trans-unit.target: The stencil value used to clear the stencil texture of the render frame

trans-unit.source: Uses @'Stride.Rendering.Compositing.SceneCameraRenderer.Child' to render a view from a camera slot. The render camera renderer takes the input from a camera in the scene so it can be displayed somewhere.
trans-unit.target: Uses @'Stride.Rendering.Compositing.SceneCameraRenderer.Child' to render a view from a camera slot. The render camera renderer takes the input from a camera in the scene so it can be displayed somewhere.

trans-unit.source: Specify a camera slot to render from
trans-unit.target: Specify a camera slot to render from

trans-unit.source: Specify a renderer for the camera (eg a forward renderer or a custom renderer)
trans-unit.target: Specify a renderer for the camera (eg a forward renderer or a custom renderer)

trans-unit.source: The scene renderer collection executes multiple renderers (eg camera renderer, render texture, etc) in sequence. This lets you set multiple renderers for an entry point. You can add as many renderers to the collection as you need.
trans-unit.target: The scene renderer collection executes multiple renderers (eg camera renderer, render texture, etc) in sequence. This lets you set multiple renderers for an entry point. You can add as many renderers to the collection as you need.

trans-unit.source: !Note Stride executes the renderers in list order.
trans-unit.target: !Note Stride executes the renderers in list order.

trans-unit.source: To add a renderer to the collection, next to Children, click Green plus button (Add) and select the renderer you want to add.
trans-unit.target: To add a renderer to the collection, next to Children, click Green plus button (Add) and select the renderer you want to add.

trans-unit.source: In a typical setup, the forward renderer renders almost everything in your scene. It renders, in order:
trans-unit.target: In a typical setup, the forward renderer renders almost everything in your scene. It renders, in order:

trans-unit.source: The forward renderer is also where you set VR options. For more information, see Virtual reality.
trans-unit.target: The forward renderer is also where you set VR options. For more information, see Virtual reality.

trans-unit.source: You configure the forward renderer properties in the forward entry node.
trans-unit.target: You configure the forward renderer properties in the forward entry node.

trans-unit.source: Uses @'Stride.Rendering.Compositing.ForceAspectRatioSceneRenderer' to force an aspect ratio and applies a letterbox if the ratio is different from the screen. Use this before the render camera.
trans-unit.target: Uses @'Stride.Rendering.Compositing.ForceAspectRatioSceneRenderer' to force an aspect ratio and applies a letterbox if the ratio is different from the screen. Use this before the render camera.

trans-unit.source: Specify a renderer for the camera (eg a forward renderer or a custom renderer)
trans-unit.target: Specify a renderer for the camera (eg a forward renderer or a custom renderer)

trans-unit.source: The aspect ratio to force the view to
trans-unit.target: The aspect ratio to force the view to

trans-unit.source: Renders to a render texture, which you can display in your scene (eg to display security camera footage on a screen). For more information, see Render textures.
trans-unit.target: Renders to a render texture, which you can display in your scene (eg to display security camera footage on a screen). For more information, see Render textures.

trans-unit.source: Specify a renderer for the camera (eg a forward renderer or a custom renderer)
trans-unit.target: Specify a renderer for the camera (eg a forward renderer or a custom renderer)

trans-unit.source: Specify a texture to render to
trans-unit.target: Specify a texture to render to

trans-unit.source: The render mask filters which groups are rendered. You can use it to only render particular models. For more information, see Render groups and render masks
trans-unit.target: The render mask filters which groups are rendered. You can use it to only render particular models. For more information, see Render groups and render masks
